Code Reference¶

helios.main()¶

runs the HELIOS RT computation if this file is executed

helios.run_helios()¶

runs a normal HELIOS run with standard I/O

class read.Read¶

class that reads in parameters, which are to be used in the HELIOS code

static delete_duplicates(long_list)¶

delete all duplicates in a list and return new list

read_command_line(quant, Vmod)¶

reads any eventual command-line arguments

read_entropy_table(quant)¶

reads in entropy and kappa (for the stellar community: delad) values from ASCII table

read_opac_file(quant, Vmod)¶

reads the opacity table

read_param_file(quant, Vmod)¶

reads the input file

read_star(quant)¶

reads the correct stellar spectrum from the corresponding file

read_temperature_file(quant)¶

reads the temperatures from a file

static set_precision(quant)¶

sets the correct precision for floating point numbers

static set_realtime_plotting(var)¶

sets the realtime plotting parameters

class write.Write¶

class that possesses all the methods to write out data

static convert_1_0_to_yes_no(variable)¶

converts a variable with value 1 or 0 to a “yes” or “no” message

static write_Rayleigh_cross_sections(quant, read)¶

writes the scattering cross sections to a file.

static write_TOA_flux_eclipse_depth(quant, read)¶

writes the TOA fluxes to a file

static write_abort_file(quant, read)¶

writes a file that tells you that the run has been aborted due to exceeding iteration steps

static write_cloud_absorption(quant, read)¶

writes the absorption opacities of the cloud to a file.

static write_cloud_scat_cross_sections(quant, read)¶

writes the scattering cross sections of the cloud to a file.

static write_colmass_mu_cp_entropy(quant, read)¶

writes the layer column mass, mean molecular weight and specific heat capacity to a file

static write_contribution_function(quant, read)¶

writes the contribution function for each layer and waveband to a file.

static write_direct_spectral_beam_flux(quant, read)¶

writes the direct irradiation beam flux to a file

static write_downward_spectral_flux(quant, read)¶

writes the downward spectral flux to a file

static write_flux_ratio_only(quant, read)¶

writes only the planetary and stellar flux ratio to a file, e.g., to be readable by Pandexo

static write_g_0(quant, read)¶

writes the scattering asymmetry paramater values to a file.

write_info(quant, read, Vmod)¶

writes the information file. Needs to be the first method to be called from all writing methods, because it creates the directory!

static write_integrated_flux(quant, read)¶

writes the integrated total and net fluxes to a file

write_mean_extinction(quant, read)¶

writes the Planck and Rosseland mean opacities & optical depths to a file.

static write_mean_werror(quantity)¶

writes an error message for quantities that could not be calculated

static write_opacities(quant, read)¶

writes the bin integrated opacities and scattering cross sections to a file.

static write_opt_depth(quant, read)¶

writes the optical depth for each layer to a file.

static write_planck_center(quant, read)¶

writes the Planck function at layer centers (+ stellar temp. and internal temp.) to a file.

static write_planck_interface(quant, read)¶

writes the Planck function at interfaces to a file

static write_tp(quant, read)¶

writes the TP-profile and the effective atmospheric temperature to a file

static write_tp_cut(quant, read)¶

writes the TP-profile up to a height of P = 1e-6 bar to a file

static write_trans_weight_function(quant, read)¶

writes the transmission weighting function for each layer and waveband to a file.

static write_transmission(quant, read)¶

writes the transmission function for each layer to a file.

static write_upward_spectral_flux(quant, read)¶

writes the upward spectral flux to a file

class computation.Compute¶

class incorporating the computational core of HELIOS

calculate_c_p(quant)¶

calculates the layer heat capacity from kappa and the mean molecular mass

calculate_contribution_function(quant)¶

calculate the transmission weighting function and the contribution function for each layer and waveband

calculate_delta_z(quant)¶

calculates the vertical widths of the layers

calculate_direct_beamflux(quant)¶

calculates the direct stellar flux at each interface

calculate_mean_opacities(quant)¶

calculates the atmospheric Planck and Rosseland mean opacities

calculate_transmission(quant)¶

calculates the transmission function in each layer for separate analysis

construct_grid(quant)¶

constructs the atmospheric grid

construct_planck_table(quant)¶

constructs the Planck table

conv_temp_iteration(quant)¶

temperature progression for the convection loop

convection_loop(quant, write, rt_plot, Vmod)¶

loops interchangeably through the radiative and convection schemes

correct_incident_energy(quant)¶

adjusts the incoming energy flux to obtain the correct brightness temperature of the planet

integrate_beamflux(quant)¶

integrates the spectral direct beam flux first over each bin and then the whole spectral range

integrate_flux(quant)¶

integrates the spectral fluxes first over each bin and then the whole spectral range

integrate_optdepth_transmission(quant)¶

calculates the transmission function in each layer

interpolate_meanmolmass(quant)¶

interpolates the mean molecular mass values from the k-table to the atmospheric layer values

interpolate_opacities_and_scattering_cross_sections(quant)¶

builds the layer and interface opacities by interpolating the values from the opacity table

interpolate_planck(quant)¶

interpolates the pre-tabulated Planck function to the layer/interface values plus stellar and internal blackbody

interpolate_temperatures(quant)¶

interpolates the layer temperatures to the interfaces

normalize_cloud_scattering(quant)¶

normalizes the cloud scattering to own lognormal grey absorption

populate_spectral_flux(quant)¶

populates the down- and upstream spectral fluxes

rad_temp_iteration(quant)¶

calculates the net flux and advances the layer temperature

radiation_loop(quant, write, rt_plot, Vmod)¶

loops over the relevant kernels iteratively until the equilibrium TP - profile reached

host_functions.approx_f_from_formula(quant, read)¶

calculates the f redistribution factor from the approximative formula from Koll et al. (2019)

host_functions.calc_F_intern(quant)¶

calculates the internal heat flux

host_functions.calc_F_ratio(quant)¶

calculates the planet to star flux ratio for sec. eclipse data interpretation

host_functions.calc_planck(lamda, temp)¶

calculates the Planckian blackbody function at a given wavelength and temperature

host_functions.calc_sensible_heat_flux(quant)¶

calculates the sensible heat flux for the surface layers

host_functions.calc_tau_lw_sw(quant, read)¶

estimates the shortwave and longwave optical depths from the TOA to BOA. This is required when using the f approximation formula of Koll et al. (2019)

host_functions.calculate_conv_flux(quant)¶

calculates the convective net flux in the atmosphere.

host_functions.calculate_height_z(quant)¶

calculates the altitude of the layer centers, either above ground or 10 bar pressure level

host_functions.check_for_global_eq(quant)¶

checks for global equilibrium

host_functions.check_for_global_local_equilibrium(quant)¶

checks for rad.-conv. convergence in terms of global and local equilibrium

host_functions.check_for_local_eq(quant)¶

checks for local equilibrium

host_functions.conv_check(quant)¶

checks whether the lapse rate exceeds the allowed dry adiabat, if yes mark it for convective correction

host_functions.conv_correct(quant, fudging)¶

corrects unstable lapse rates to dry adiabats, conserving the total enthalpy

host_functions.convective_adjustment(quant)¶

adjusts the atmosphere for convective equilibrium.

host_functions.initial_temp(quant, read, Vmod)¶

determines the initial temperature profile

host_functions.mark_convective_layers(quant, stitching)¶

marks the layers where convection dominates over radiative transfer

host_functions.planet_param(quant, read)¶

sets the planetary, stellar and orbital parameters and converts them to the correct units

host_functions.relax_global_limit(quant)¶

makes the global convergence limit less strict for difficult cases

host_functions.set_up_numerical_parameters(quant)¶

sets up additional parameters used in the calculation

host_functions.stitching_convective_zone_holes(quant)¶

fills up holes in the convective zones if they are preventing convergence

host_functions.success_message(quant)¶

prints the message that you have been desperately waiting for

host_functions.sum_mean_optdepth(quant, i, opac)¶

returns the summed up optical depth from the TOA with an opacity source, e.g. Rosseland mean opacity

host_functions.temp_calcs(quant)¶

computes the final effective temperature

class realtime_plotting.Plot¶

class including all the plotting utensils

static plot_convective_feedback(quant)¶

plots the tp profile and the net flux in realtime

static plot_tp(quant)¶

plots the TP-profile in realtime

class quantities.Store¶

class that stores parameters, quantities, arrays, etc., used in the HELIOS code

allocate_on_device(Vmod)¶

allocate memory for arrays existing only on the GPU

convert_input_list_to_array(Vmod)¶

converts lists of quantities to arrays

copy_device_to_host()¶

copies relevant device arrays to host

copy_host_to_device(Vmod)¶

copies relevant host arrays to device

create_zero_arrays(Vmod)¶

creates zero arrays of quantities to be used on the GPU with the correct length/dimension

dimensions()¶

create the correct dimensions of the grid from input parameters

class Vcoupling_modification.Vcoupling¶

class that embodies everything needed to couple HELIOS and VULCAN

combine_to_mixed_opacities(quant)¶

combine the individual molecular opacities to layer/interface opacities

combine_to_scat_cross(quant)¶

create layer scattering cross-sections

interpolate_f_molecule_and_meanmolmass(quant)¶

interpolates the layer mixing ratios and the mean molecular mass to the interfaces

interpolate_molecular_and_mixed_opac(quant)¶

interpolates the molecular opacity tables to layer and interface values

static read_ind_molecule_opac(quant, name, read_grid_parameters=False)¶

reads the file with the opacity table

read_layer_molecular_abundance(quant)¶

reads the molecular abundance from the VULCAN output file

read_molecular_opacities(quant)¶

reads the individual molecular opacities

read_or_create_iter_count()¶

writes the TP-profile to a file

test_coupling_convergence(quant)¶

test whether TP profile converged and ends coupled iteration

write_tp_VULCAN(quant)¶

writes the TP-profile to a file

class clouds.Cloud¶

class that reads in cloud parameters, which then can be used in the HELIOS code

conversion_of_cloud_parameters(quant)¶

converts the cloud parameters to the HELIOS wavelength grid

convert_to_new_grid(int_lambda, cent_lambda, orig_lambda, orig_value)¶

generic function to convert values from one grid to another

main_cloud_method(quant)¶

main method to handle cloud input

static onetoleft(array, limit)¶

small function to find the index of an array element whose value is closest to the left of a given limit

read_cloud_dat(quant)¶

reads the cloud file (courtesy of D. Kitzmann)

read_cloud_h5(quant)¶

reads int the cloud .h5 file

write_cloud_h5(quant)¶

creates a h5 container with the interpolated cloud parameters

GPU-accelerated radiative transfer code for exoplanetary atmospheres
